description.description: A short description of this preset. Useful if you have multiple files

name.description: Displayed in-game. Spaces will be replaced with underscores.

glitches_required.description: Determine the logic required to complete the seed.

minor_glitches.description: Puts fake flipper, water-walk, super bunny, etc into logic

overworld_glitches.description: Assumes the player has knowledge of both overworld major glitches (boots clips, mirror clips) and minor glitches (fake flipper, super bunny shenanigans, water walk and etc.)

no_logic.description: Your items are placed with no regard to any logic. Your Fire Rod could be on your Trinexx.

dark_room_logic.description: Logic to use for dark rooms.

lamp.description: The lamp is required for dark rooms to be considered in logic.

torches.description: In addition to the lamp, a fire rod and accessible torches may put dark rooms into logic.

none.description: Dark rooms are always considered in logic, which may require you to navigate rooms in complete darkness.

restrict_dungeon_item_on_boss.description: Prevent dungeon bosses from dropping maps, compasses, and keys.

on.description: Dungeon bosses will never drop maps, compasses, or keys.

off.description: Dungeon bosses may drop any item.

map_shuffle.description: Shuffle dungeon maps into the world and other dungeons, including other players' worlds.

compass_shuffle.description: Shuffle compasses into the world and other dungeons, including other players' worlds

smallkey_shuffle.description: Shuffle small keys into the world and other dungeons, including other players' worlds.

universal.description: Allows small keys to be used in any dungeon and adds keys to shops so you can buy more.

bigkey_shuffle.description: Shuffle big keys into the world and other dungeons, including other players' worlds.

local_keys.description: Keep small keys and big keys local to your world.

dungeon_counters.description: Determines when to show an on-screen counter for dungeon items.

on.description: Always display amount of items checked in a dungeon.

pickup.description: Show when compass is picked up.

default.description: Show when the compass is picked up, if the compass was shuffled.

accessibility.description: Determines how much of the game is guaranteed to be reachable.

items.description: Guarantees you will be able to acquire all items, but you may not be able to access all locations.

locations.description: Guarantees you will be able to access all locations, and therefore all items.

none.description: Guarantees only that the game is beatable. You may not be able to access all locations or acquire all items.

progressive.description: Enable or disable the progressive acquisition of certain items (swords, shields, bow).

on.description: All relevant items are acquired progressively.

off.description: All relevant items are acquired non-progressively (tempered sword may be in Link's House).

random.description: The progressive nature of items is determined per-item pool. Gloves may be progressive, but swords may not be.

entrance_shuffle.description: Determines how often and by what rules entrances are shuffled.

none.description: Vanilla game map. All entrances and exits lead to their original locations.

dungeonssimple.description: Shuffle whole dungeons amongst each other. Hyrule Castle would always be one dungeon.

dungeonsfull.description: Shuffle any dungeon entrance with any dungeon interior, so Hyrule Castle could be four different dungeons.

simple.description: Entrances are grouped together before being randomized. This option uses the most strict grouping rules.

restricted.description: Entrances are grouped together before being randomized. Grouping rules are less strict than Simple Shuffle.

full.description: Entrances are grouped before being randomized. Grouping rules are less strict than Restricted Shuffle.

crossed.description: Entrances are grouped before being randomized. Grouping rules are less strict than Full Shuffle.

insanity.description: Very few entrance grouping rules are applied. Good luck.

goals.description: Determines how much work you need to put in to save Hyrule.

ganon.description: Climb Ganon's Tower, defeat Agahnim, then defeat Ganon in his lair.

fast_ganon.description: Kill Ganon in his lair. The hole is always open, but you may still require some crystals to damage him.

bosses.description: Defeat the boss of all dungeons, defeat Agahnim in both Castle Tower and Ganon's Tower, then defeat Ganon in his lair.

pedestal.description: Acquire all three pendants and pull the Triforce from the Master Sword Pedestal.

ganon_pedestal.description: Accquire all three pendants, pull the Master Sword Pedestal, then defeat Ganon in his lair.

triforce_hunt.description: Collect enough pieces of the Triforce of Courage, which has been spread around the world, then turn them in to Murahadala, who is standing outside Hyrule Castle.

local_triforce_hunt.description: Same as Triforce Hunt, but the Triforce pieces are guaranteed to be in your world.

ganon_triforce_hunt.description: Same as Triforce Hunt, but you need to defeat Ganon in his lair instead of talking with Murahadala.

local_ganon_triforce_hunt.description: Same as Local Triforce Hunt, but you need to defeat Ganon in his lair instead of talking with Murahadala.

ice_rod_hunt.description: Look for the Ice Rod within your 215 available checks, then go kill Trinexx at Turtle rock.

goal.description: Opens the pyramid if the goal requires you to kill Ganon, unless the goal is Slow Ganon or All Dungeons.

auto.description: Same as Goal, but also opens when any non-dungeon entrance shuffle is used.

yes.description: Pyramid hole is always open. Ganon's vulnerable condition is still required before he can he hurt.

no.description: Pyramid hole is always closed until you defeat Agahnim atop Ganon's Tower.

triforce_pieces_required.description: Determines the total number of Triforce pieces required before speaking with Murahadala

15.description: 15 Triforce pieces are required before speaking with Murahadala.

20.description: 20 Triforce pieces are required before speaking with Murahadala.

30.description: 30 Triforce pieces are required before speaking with Murahadala.

40.description: 40 Triforce pieces are required before speaking with Murahadala.

50.description: 50 Triforce pieces are required before speaking with Murahadala.

triforce_pieces_mode.description: Determines which of the following three options will be used to determine the total available triforce pieces.

available.description: Explicitly tell the generator how many triforce pieces to place throughout Hyrule.

extra.description: Set the number of triforce pieces in Hyrule equal to the number of required pieces plus a number specified by this option.

percentage.description: Set the number of triforce pieces in Hyrule equal to the number of required pieces plus a percentage specified by this option.

triforce_pieces_available.description: Only used if enabled in Triforce Piece Availability Mode.

25.description: 25 Triforce pieces will be hidden throughout Hyrule

30.description: 30 Triforce pieces will be hidden throughout Hyrule

40.description: 40 Triforce pieces will be hidden throughout Hyrule

50.description: 50 Triforce pieces will be hidden throughout Hyrule

triforce_pieces_extra.description: Only used if enabled in Triforce Piece Availability Mode.

0.description: No extra Triforce pieces will be hidden throughout Hyrule

5.description: 5 extra Triforce pieces will be hidden throughout Hyrule

10.description: 10 extra Triforce pieces will be hidden throughout Hyrule

15.description: 15 extra Triforce pieces will be hidden throughout Hyrule

20.description: 20 extra Triforce pieces will be hidden throughout Hyrule

triforce_pieces_percentage.description: Only used if enabled in Triforce Piece Availability Mode.

100.description: No extra Triforce pieces will be hidden throughout Hyrule

150.description: 50% more triforce pieces than required will be placed throughout Hyrule.

200.description: 50% more triforce pieces than required will be placed throughout Hyrule.

tower_open.description: Determines the number of crystals required to open Ganon's Tower.

0.description: 0 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

1.description: 1 Crystal is required to open Ganon's Tower.

2.description: 2 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

3.description: 3 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

4.description: 4 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

5.description: 5 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

6.description: 6 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

7.description: 7 Crystals are required to open Ganon's Tower.

random.description: Randomly determine the number of crystals necessary to open Ganon's Tower.

ganon_open.description: Determines the number of crystals required before you are able to damage Ganon.

0.description: 0 Crystals are required to damage Ganon.

1.description: 1 Crystal is required to damage Ganon.

2.description: 2 Crystals are required to damage Ganon.

3.description: 3 Crystals are required to damage Ganon.

4.description: 4 Crystals are required to damage Ganon.

5.description: 5 Crystals are required to damage Ganon.

6.description: 6 Crystals are required to damage Ganon.

7.description: 7 Crystals are required to damage Ganon.

random.description: Randomly determine the number of crystals necessary to damage Ganon.

mode.description: Determines the mode, or world state, for your game.

standard.description: Begin the game by rescuing Zelda from her cell and escorting her to the Sanctuary.

open.description: Begin the game from your choice of Link's House or the Sanctuary.

inverted.description: Begin in the Dark World. The Moon Pearl is required to avoid bunny-state in Light World, and the Light World game map is altered.

retro.description: Makes the game similar to the first Legend of Zelda. You must buy a quiver to use the bow, take-any caves and an old-man cave are added to the world, and you may need to find your sword from the old man's cave.

hints.description: Determines the behavior of hint tiles in dungeons

on.description: Hint tiles sometimes give item location hints.

weapons.description: Determines how swords are placed throughout the world.

randomized.description: Swords are placed randomly throughout the world.

assured.description: Begin the game with a sword. Other swords are placed randomly throughout the game world.

vanilla.description: Swords are placed in vanilla locations in your own game (uncle, pedestal, smiths, pyramid fairy).

swordless.description: Your swords are replaced with rupees. Gameplay changes are made to accommodate this change.

item_pool.description: Determines the availability of upgrades, progressive items, and convenience items.

easy.description: Double the number of available upgrades and progressive items.

normal.description: Item availability remains unchanged from the vanilla game.

hard.description: Reduced upgrade availability (max: 14 hearts, blue mail, tempered sword, fire shield, no silvers unless swordless).

expert.description: Minimum upgrade availability (max: 8 hearts, green mail, master sword, fighter shield, no silvers unless swordless).

item_functionality.description: Alters the usefulness of various items in the game.

easy.description: Increases helpfulness of items. Medallions are usable everywhere, even without a sword. Hammer can be used in place of master sword to beat ganon and collect the tablets.

normal.description: Item functionality remains unchanged from the vanilla game.

hard.description: Reduced helpfulness of items. Potions are less effective, you can't catch faeries, the Magic Cape uses double magic, the Cane of Byrna does not grant invulnerability, boomerangs do not stun, and silver arrows are disabled outside ganon.

expert.description: Vastly reduces the helpfulness of items. Potions are barely effective, you can't catch faeries, the Magic Cape uses double magic, the Cane of Byrna does not grant invulnerability, boomerangs and hookshot do not stun, and the silver arrows are disabled outside ganon.

progression_balancing.description: A system to reduce time spent in BK mode. It moves your items into an earlier access sphere to make it more likely you have access to progression items.

boss_shuffle.description: Determines which boss appears in which dungeon.

simple.description: Existing bosses except Ganon and Agahnim are shuffled throughout dungeons.

full.description: Bosses are shuffled, and three of them may occur twice.

random.description: Any boss may appear any number of times.

singularity.description: Picks a boss at random and puts it in every dungeon it can appear in. Remaining dungeons bosses are chosen at random.

enemy_shuffle.description: Randomizes which enemies appear throughout the game.

killable_thieves.description: Determines whether thieves may be killed or not.

tile_shuffle.description: Randomizes tile layouts in rooms where floor tiles attack you.

misery_mire_medallion.description: Determines the medallion required to access Misery Mire

quake.description: Quake will be required ot enter Misery Mire.

bombos.description: Bombos will be required ot enter Misery Mire.

ether.description: Ether will be required ot enter Misery Mire.

turtle_rock_medallion.description: Determines the medallion required to access Turtle Rock

quake.description: Quake will be required ot enter Turtle Rock.

bombos.description: Bombos will be required ot enter Turtle Rock.

ether.description: Ether will be required ot enter Turtle Rock.

bush_shuffle.description: Randomize the chance that bushes around Hyrule have enemies hiding under them.

enemy_damage.description: Randomizes how much damage enemies can deal to you.

default.description: Enemies deal the same damage as in the vanilla game.

shuffled.description: Enemies deal zero to four hearts of damage, and armor reduces this damage.

random.description: Enemies may deal zero through eight hearts of damage, and armor re-shuffles how much damage you take from each enemy.

enemy_health.description: Randomizes the amount of health enemies have. Does not affect bosses.

default.description: Enemies have the same amount of health as in the vanilla game.

expert.description: Enemies will be very hard to defeat.

pot_shuffle.description: Keys, items, and buttons hidden under pots in dungeons may be shuffled with other pots in their super-tile.

beemizer_total_chance.description: Chance to replace junk-fill items in the global item pool with single bees and bee traps.

25.description: 25% chance for each junk-fill item (rupees, bombs and arrows) to be replaced with bees.

50.description: 50% chance for each junk-fill item (rupees, bombs and arrows) to be replaced with bees.

75.description: 75% chance for each junk-fill item (rupees, bombs and arrows) to be replaced with bees.

100.description: All junk-fill items (rupees, bombs and arrows) are replaced with bees.

beemizer_trap_chance.description: Chance that replaced junk-fill items are bee traps.

60.description: 60% chance for each beemizer replacement to be a trap (40% chance of a single bee).

70.description: 70% chance for each beemizer replacement to be a trap (30% chance of a single bee).

80.description: 80% chance for each beemizer replacement to be a trap (20% chance of a single bee).

90.description: 90% chance for each beemizer replacement to be a trap (10% chance of a single bee).

100.description: All beemizer replacements are traps (no single bees).

shop_shuffle.description: Alters the inventory and prices of shops.

f.description: Randomly generate an inventory for each shop from a pool of non-progression items.

p.description: Randomizes the price of items sold in shops.

u.description: Shuffles capacity upgrades throughout the game world.

gp.description: Shuffles the inventory and randomizes the prices of items in shops.

fp.description: Randomizes the inventory and prices of shops.

ufp.description: Randomizes the inventory and prices in shops, and distributes capacity upgrades throughout the world.

wfp.description: Randomizes the inventory prices of shops, and shuffles items in the potion shop.

ufpw.description: Randomizes the inventory and prices in shops, distributes capacity upgrades throughout the world, and shuffles items in the potion shop.

shop_shuffle_slots.description: Move items from the general item pool into shops for purchase.

shuffle_prizes.description: Alters the Prizes from pulling, bonking, enemy kills, digging, and hoarders

none.description: All prizes from pulling, bonking, enemy kills, digging, hoarders are vanilla.

g.description: Shuffles the prizes from pulling, enemy kills, digging, hoarders

b.description: Shuffles the prizes from bonking into trees.

timer.description: Add a timer to the game UI, and cause it to have various effects.

none.description: No timed mode is applied to the game.

timed.description: Starts with clock at zero. Green clocks subtract 4 minutes (total 20). Blue clocks subtract 2 minutes (total 10). Red clocks add two minutes (total 10). Winner is the player with the lowest time at the end.

timed_ohko.description: Starts the clock at ten minutes. Green clocks add five minutes (total 25). As long as the clock as at zero, Link will die in one hit.

ohko.description: Timer always at zero. Permanent OHKO.

timed_countdown.description: Starts the clock with forty minutes. Same clocks as timed mode, but if the clock hits zero you lose. You can still keep playing, though.

display.description: Displays a timer, but otherwise does not affect gameplay or the item pool.

countdown_start_time.description: The amount of time, in minutes, to start with in Timed Countdown and Timed OHKO modes.

0.description: Start with no time on the timer. In Timed OHKO mode, start in OHKO mode.

10.description: Start with 10 minutes on the timer.

20.description: Start with 20 minutes on the timer.

30.description: Start with 30 minutes on the timer.

60.description: Start with an hour on the timer.

red_clock_time.description: The amount of time, in minutes, to add to or subtract from the timer upon picking up a red clock.

-2.description: Subtract 2 minutes from the timer upon picking up a red clock.

1.description: Add a minute to the timer upon picking up a red clock.

blue_clock_time.description: The amount of time, in minutes, to add to or subtract from the timer upon picking up a blue clock.

1.description: Add a minute to the timer upon picking up a blue clock.

2.description: Add 2 minutes to the timer upon picking up a blue clock.

green_clock_time.description: The amount of time, in minutes, to add to or subtract from the timer upon picking up a green clock.

4.description: Add 4 minutes to the timer upon picking up a green clock.

10.description: Add 10 minutes to the timer upon picking up a green clock.

15.description: Add 15 minutes to the timer upon picking up a green clock.

glitch_boots.description: Start with Pegasus Boots in any glitched logic mode that makes use of them.

door_shuffle.description: Shuffles the interior layout of dungeons. Only available if the host rolls the game using the doors version of the generator.

vanilla.description: Doors within dungeons remain unchanged from the vanilla game.

crossed.description: Dungeons are shuffled across each other. Eastern may contain POD, Mire, and Hera.

intensity.description: Specifies what types of doors will be shuffled.

1.description: Doors and spiral staircases will be shuffled amongst themselves.

2.description: Doors, open edges, and straight stair cases are shuffled amongst each other. Spiral staircases will be shuffled amongst themselves.

3.description: Level 2 plus lobby shuffling, which means any non-dead-end supertile with a south-facing door may become a dungeon entrance.

random.description: Randomly chooses an intensity level from 1-3.

key_drop_shuffle.description: Allows the small/big keys dropped by enemies/pots to be shuffled into the item pool. This extends the number of checks from 216 to 249

disablemusic.description: Enable or disable all in-game music. Sound-effects are unaffected.

reduceflashing.description: Enable or disable full-screen flashing effects in game.

quickswap.description: Quickly change items by pressing the L+R shoulder buttons. Pressing L+R at the same time toggles the in-slot item (arrows and silver arrows, for example).

triforcehud.description: Hide the triforce hud in certain circumstances.

hide_goal.description: Hide Triforce HUD elements until a single triforce piece is acquired or you speak to Murahadala

hide_total.description: Hide total triforce pieces needed to win the game until you speak with Murahadala

hide_both.description: Combination of Hide HUD and Hide Total

menuspeed.description: Choose how fast the in-game menu opens and closes.

normal.description: Menu speed is unchanged from the vanilla game.

instant.description: The in-game menu appears and disappears instantly.

double.description: The in-game menu animation moves at double speed.

triple.description: The in-game menu animation moves at triple speed.

quadruple.description: The in-game menu animation moves at quadruple speed.

half.description: The in-game menu animation moves at half speed.

heartcolor.description: Changes the color of your in-game health hearts.

random.description: Health heart color is chosen randomly from red, green, blue, and yellow.

heartbeep.description: Controls the frequency of the low-health beeping.

double.description: Doubles the frequency of the low-health beep.

normal.description: Heart beep frequency is unchanged from the vanilla game.

quarter.description: Heart beep plays at one quarter-speed.

ow_palettes.description: Randomize the colors of the overworld, within reason.

random.description: Shuffles the colors of the overworld palette.

blackout.description: Never use this. Makes all overworld palette colors black.

classic.description: Produces results similar to the website.

dizzy.description: No logic in colors but saturation and lightness are conserved.

sick.description: No logic in colors but lightness is conserved.

uw_palettes.description: Randomize the colors of the underworld (caves, dungeons, etc.), within reason.

random.description: Shuffles the colors of the underworld palette.

blackout.description: Never use this. Makes all underworld palette colors black.

classic.description: Produces results similar to the website.

dizzy.description: No logic in colors but saturation and lightness are conserved.

sick.description: No logic in colors but lightness is conserved.

hud_palettes.description: Randomize the colors of the HUD (user interface), within reason.

random.description: Shuffles the colors of the HUD palette.

blackout.description: Never use this. Makes all HUD palette colors black.

classic.description: Produces results similar to the website.

dizzy.description: No logic in colors but saturation and lightness are conserved.

sick.description: No logic in colors but lightness is conserved.

shield_palettes.description: Randomize the colors of the shield, within reason.

random.description: Shuffles the colors of the shield palette.

blackout.description: Never use this. Makes all shield palette colors black.

classic.description: Produces results similar to the website.

dizzy.description: No logic in colors but saturation and lightness are conserved.

sick.description: No logic in colors but lightness is conserved.

sword_palettes.description: Randomize the colors of the sword, within reason.

random.description: Shuffles the colors of the sword palette.

blackout.description: Never use this. Makes all sword palette colors black.

classic.description: Produces results similar to the website.

dizzy.description: No logic in colors but saturation and lightness are conserved.

sick.description: No logic in colors but lightness is conserved.
